info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 11:08PM CDT until April 10 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Lake Fork Creek Near Quitman affecting Wood County.
For the Lake Fork Creek...including Quitman...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Lake Fork Creek near Quitman.
* WHEN...Until Thursday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding problems. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the creek bottoms should move them to higher ground.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 PM CDT Monday was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday morning and continue falling to 9.2 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 08/15/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening at 1115 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING
